intro: Cuphea ferrisiae var. rosea, commonly known as the roseum cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking colorful, low-maintenance plants. Its ornamental value is enhanced by the contrast between its deep red blooms and its green foliage.
